sub_fields.label: Box stem (and construction)
sub_fields.name: box-stem
sub_fields.instructions: Does the stem have a box surround

sub_fields.label: Switch volume
sub_fields.name: volume
sub_fields.instructions: Silent switch with internal dampers, or loud clicky switch?

choices.silent: This is a silent switch with internal rubber dampers
choices.normal: Standard switch with no dampers, can be further silenced with lubrication or O-rings
choices.loud: This is a loud switch. Not recommended for use in an office environment or others that don't appreciated a loud keyboard ;)

sub_fields.label: Volume notes
sub_fields.name: volume_notes
sub_fields.placeholder: eg. This switch is especially loud. Would avoid using in office situation (Box Navy?)

sub_fields.label: Lubrication notes
sub_fields.name: lube_notes
sub_fields.instructions: Does this switch in particular benefit from being lubricated? Is it worth doing? What kind of lubrication works best?

sub_fields.label: Does this switch benefit from being switch filmed?
sub_fields.name: film
sub_fields.instructions:
Switch films help keep switches more stable, reducing movement and wobbling.

Great explanation video here - https://youtu.be/ndT_TTQLflI
Great demonstration video here - https://gfycat.com/unlinedsmartleafhopper

Note: Not compatible with Kailh switches.

choices.yes: Yes, this switch in particular is vastly improved when switch films are used.
choices.no: The benefits of using switch films on these are negligible. Considered not worth using.
choices.no-fit: No, and in addition, it has been found that switch films do not fit these switches.
choices.unknown: Not able to find any data. Add link on website encouraging anyone with experience to get in touch.

sub_fields.label: Film notes
sub_fields.name: film_notes
sub_fields.instructions: Do some films work and others not?

sub_fields.label: Spring color info
sub_fields.name: spring-color-info
sub_fields.placeholder: eg. The springs in these switches have a black coating to help reduce spring noise.

sub_fields.label: Spring swap info
sub_fields.name: spring-swap
sub_fields.placeholder: eg. The factory springs are terrible. Definitely worth swapping to a SPRiT or TX spring. A good all round choice might be a 65g weight.

fields.label: Variations
fields.name: specs
fields.instructions:
Some switches have multiple spring weighting options (Zealios for example) and also different stem/housing colours with different weightings (Gateron Laser).
Most switches will only have one entry here but in cases where there is more than one, the first one will be shown on the main website listing.

Nylon (Polyamide) | PC (Polycarbonate) | POM (Polyoxymethylene) | UHMWPE (Ultra-high-molecular-weight polyethylene).

sub_fields.label: Variation name
sub_fields.name: name
sub_fields.instructions:
No always necessary because sometimes it's just a different weighting, for example in the case of Tealios, Zealios etc. that come in 63.5g, 65g, 67g etc.
But in the case of YOK Trash/Polar/Red Pandas it's important to give them a name because they're all the same switch just different colours.

choices.transparent: Transparent (clear and coloured) - leave colour blank if completely clear
Transparent (clear and coloured) - leave colour blank if completely clear
Transparent (clear and coloured) - leave colour blank if completely clear

sub_fields.message: If using black please use #3a4045 instead of #000000 - otherwise the switch icon loses all shading and contrast.

sub_fields.label: Force graph
sub_fields.name: force-graph
sub_fields.instructions: Force graph data might be found here https://plotly.com/~haata Images for these can be extracted from each graph by browsing to a switch eg. for Gateron Brown choose the embed icon option at the bottom. The link to the png version can be found there.

sub_fields.label: LED Support
sub_fields.name: led-support
sub_fields.instructions: Does the switch have a space to allow light to shine through from beneath or allow space for LED's?

choices.smd-and-inswitch: Both SMD and in-switch/through hole LED compatible

sub_fields.message: Here are some great links to figures and stats already out there on the web if you're struggling for numbers: thegamingsetup.com, Google spreadsheet 1, Google spreadsheet 2, Mechwiki, Switch data

fields.label: Limited run
fields.name: limited-run
fields.instructions: These switches were a limited run and are no longer being manufactured.

choices.past-limited: Limited group buy but date has past

fields.label: Limited run - more information
fields.name: limited-run-info
fields.instructions: If this switch was only available for a limited time give some background information here.

fields.message: Prices below will be listed in order that they appear here - The 1st item in list will appear in main list (before hover)

sub_fields.label: Price
sub_fields.name: price
sub_fields.instructions: Enter price from vendor website using local currency. Currency symbol will be added on the front-end.

sub_fields.label: Extra text
sub_fields.name: extra_text
sub_fields.instructions: Useful for switch pages with multiple variations. eg. Trash, Mint, Polar, Red Panda

fields.label: Links
fields.name: links
fields.instructions: It's worth checking ThereminGoat's GitHub PDF Repository of switch score sheets if one exists for this switch then link it here.

fields.label: Similar
fields.name: similar
fields.instructions: This is not in use at the moment but in the future it would be nice to be able to suggest other similar switches.
